io.spine.server.storage

Class RecordStorage<I,R extends com.google.protobuf.Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.storage.AbstractStorage<I,R>
      • io.spine.server.storage.RecordStorage<I,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the record identifiers
    R - the type of the stored message records
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storage<I,R>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InMemoryRecordStorage, RecordStorageDelegate

    @SPI
public abstract class RecordStorage<I,R extends com.google.protobuf.Message>
extends AbstractStorage<I,R>
    An abstract base for storage implementations, which store the Protobuf messages as records.

    Each stored record must be identified.

    Additionally, some attributes may be stored along with the record itself to allow further querying.

      • read

        public java.util.Optional<R> read(I id)
        Description copied from interface: Storage
        Reads a record from the storage by the specified record identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the record to read
        Returns:
        a record instance or Optional.empty() if there is no record matching this request

      • read

        protected java.util.Optional<R> read(I id,
                                     com.google.protobuf.FieldMask mask)
        Reads the message record by the passed identifier and applies the given field mask to it.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the message record to read
        mask - the field mask to apply
        Returns:
        the record with the given identifier, after the field mask has been applied to it, or Optional.empty() if no record is found by the ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • readAll

        protected java.util.Iterator<R> readAll()
        Reads all message records in the storage.

        This method should be used with the performance and memory considerations in mind.

        Returns:
        iterator over the records
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • readAll

        protected java.util.Iterator<R> readAll(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids)
        Reads all the message records according to the passed identifiers.

        The response contains only the records which were found.

        Parameters:
        ids - the identifiers of the records to read
        Returns:
        iterator over the records with the passed IDs
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • readAll

        protected java.util.Iterator<R> readAll(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids,
                                        com.google.protobuf.FieldMask mask)
        Reads all the message records according to the passed record identifiers and returns each record applying the passed field mask.

        The response contains only the records which were found.

        Parameters:
        ids - the identifiers of the records to read
        mask - the mask to apply to each record
        Returns:
        the iterator over the records
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • readAll

        protected java.util.Iterator<R> readAll(io.spine.query.RecordQuery<I,R> query)
        Reads all message records according to the passed query.

        The default ResponseFormat is used.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute
        Returns:
        iterator over the matching records
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • delete

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
protected boolean delete(I id)
        Physically deletes the message record from the storage by the record identifier.

        In case the record with the specified identifier is not found in the storage, this method does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the record to delete
        Returns:
        true if the record was deleted, or false if the record with the specified identifier was not found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • deleteAll

        protected void deleteAll(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids)
        Deletes the batch of message records by their identifiers.

        If for some provided identifiers there is no records in the storage, such identifiers are silently skipped.

        Parameters:
        ids - identifiers of the records to delete
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

        protected io.spine.query.RecordQuery<I,R> toQuery(I id)

                                                  com.google.protobuf.FieldMask mask)
        Creates a new query for the target with the specified ID, which, if exists, should be returned according to the specified field mask.

      • toQuery

        protected io.spine.query.RecordQuery<I,R> toQuery(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids)
        Creates a new query for the targets which have one of the passed identifiers.

      • toQuery

        protected io.spine.query.RecordQuery<I,R> toQuery(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids,
                                                  com.google.protobuf.FieldMask mask)
        Creates a new query for the targets which have one of the passed identifiers.

        The results will contain only the fields specified by the given field mask.

      • deleteRecord

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
protected abstract boolean deleteRecord(I id)
        Performs the physical removal of the message record from the storage by the identifier of the record.

        In case the record with the specified identifier is not found in the storage, this method does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the record to delete
        Returns:
        true if the record was deleted, or false if the record with the specified identifier was not found
